header_summary:
The recent developments in Bitcoin Core include the announcement of version v28.3rc2, available for download with preliminary release notes to guide users through the updates and potential improvements ([Bitcoin Core's official website](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-28.3/test.rc2/)). Following this, version 29.2 was released, incorporating a range of bug fixes, performance enhancements, and updated translations aimed at refining user experience, with contributions from various developers such as Amisha Chhajed, Eugene Siegel, and Luke Dashjr, among others ([Bitcoin Core's official website](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-29.2/)).

In parallel, advancements in network security algorithms have been discussed, with a focus on an updated reputation algorithm undergoing simulation testing to evaluate its defense against resource and sink attacks, showcasing its ability to distinguish between honest and dishonest network participants effectively ([DelvingBitcoin](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/outgoing-reputation-simulation-results-and-updates/2069)). Meanwhile, the deployment of a demo instance for the peer-observer tool has been made public, offering insights into its functionality for monitoring the Bitcoin P2P network, thanks to the sponsorship from [LCL Host](https://lclhost.org/) and contributions from 0xB10C ([Demo Instance](https://demo.peer.observer)).

Additionally, discussions around integrating Zero-Knowledge (ZK) verification into Bitcoin have evolved, highlighting an alternative metaprotocol approach for embedding STARK proofs without altering the base protocol. This method emphasizes risk reduction, market-driven adoption, and the potential for future integration into Bitcoin Script, should it prove successful and safe ([DelvingBitcoin](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/proposal-op-stark-verify-native-stark-proof-verification-in-bitcoin-script/2056/4)).

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 28.3 Release Candidate 2 Available
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core announced the new version v28.3rc2, available for download.
- Preliminary release notes detail changes and improvements for users and developers.
- This release candidate will become version v28.3 if no major issues are found.

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core v29.2 Released
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core version 29.2 offers bug fixes, performance boosts, and updated translations.
- Upgrade guidance includes shutting down old versions and specific installation steps per OS.
- The update has been tested on recent Linux, macOS, and Windows versions, ensuring broad compatibility.

recent_posts.title: Outgoing Reputation: Simulation Results and Updates
recent_posts.summary:
- The updated algorithm effectively counters resource and sink attacks, ensuring financial stability.
- Implementing general bucket limitations mirrors Bitcoin Core's strategy, maintaining network access for users.
- Future plans include real-world data analysis to refine the algorithm, inviting community testing.

recent_posts.title: Peer-observer: A tool and infrastructure for monitoring the Bitcoin P2P network for attacks and anomalies
recent_posts.summary:
- A demo of the peer-observer is live, featuring two nodes named `hal` and `len`.
- It was launched with support from [https://lclhost.org/](https://lclhost.org/)'s server resources.
- Technical setup details are available at [https://github.com/0xB10C/peer-observer-infra-demo](https://github.com/0xB10C/peer-observer-infra-demo).

recent_posts.title: Proposal: OP_STARK_VERIFY - Native STARK Proof Verification in Bitcoin Script
recent_posts.summary:
- A metaprotocol enables Zero-Knowledge verification on Bitcoin without altering its base protocol.
- It promotes risk reduction, market-driven adoption, and technological evolution in cryptographic proofs.
- Successful adoption could lead to integrating this technology natively into Bitcoin Script.

active_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] Limit ScriptPubkey Size >= 520 Bytes Consensus.
authors: [BIP Proposal] Limit ScriptPubkey Size >= 520 Bytes Consensus PortlandHODL
active_posts.summary:
- Brandon Black proposes a Bitcoin soft fork to limit ScriptPubkey size for network security.
- The fork aims for consensus on outpoints over 520 bytes becoming invalid, enhancing scalability.
- Potential concerns consider future tech needs but the proposal welcomes community feedback.

active_posts.title: Bitcoin Core v30.0 Released
active_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core version 30.0 introduces new features, bug fixes, and security enhancements.
- Users must shut down older versions for a straightforward upgrade, ensuring compatibility with recent OS.
- Significant changes include transaction policy updates, network enhancements, and improved user and developer interfaces.

active_posts.title: Compact block relay in knots using the extra pool
active_posts.summary:
- A developer tested compact block relay in Bitcoin Knots, improving synchronization and efficiency.
- Block 919005's analysis showed high reconstruction success with minimal transaction requests from peers.
- The experiment invites further community feedback to enhance Bitcoin's compact block relay process.

active_posts.title: Stats on compact block reconstructions
active_posts.summary:
- The study examines block reconstructions in the Bitcoin network, focusing on transaction awareness and node configurations.
- Adjustments, like `dave` increasing connections and `erin` adopting `mempoolfullrbf=1`, impacted block reconstruction efficiency.
- Analysis indicates improved efficiency with `mempoolfullrbf=1` and varied reconstruction times based on node connectivity and hardware.

active_posts.title: Sharing block templates
active_posts.summary:
- Recent Bitcoin node and miner policies include full RBF, enhanced spam filters, and a minimum fee rate.
- Compact block relay significantly decreases block propagation times and expected orphan rates.
- Alternative solutions like weak blocks and template sharing aim to improve network efficiency and robustness.

active_posts.title: Eclipsing Bitcoin Nodes with BGP Interception Attacks
active_posts.summary:
- A stealthier variant of BGP hijacking threatens Bitcoin network security through eclipse attacks.
- Attackers manipulate BGP routes to intercept Bitcoin node traffic, enabling potential financial abuses.
- Proposed mitigations include network data use for defense and enhancing peer connection security.

today_in_history_posts.title: Ephemeral Anchors: Fixing V3 Package RBF against package limit pinning
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Greg Sanders discussed V3 transactions and pinning attacks in a Bitcoin-dev email.
- He proposed Ephemeral Anchors to solve package limit pinning issues.
- Open questions remain about MEV risks and SIGHASH_GROUP-like constructs.

today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bastien and John discussed Lightning protocol limitations and liquidity movement solutions.
- They explored a pre-signed transaction mechanism to improve liquidity management and capital efficiency.
- Their conversation and proposals about enhancing the protocol were shared on GitHub in Pull Request 863.

today_in_history_posts.title: Thoughts on scaling and consensus changes (2023)
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin scalability involves establishing 50,000 off-chain entities like "bitcoin banks" for a billion users.
- These entities, linked for liquidity, rely on semi-trusted services to balance cost and security.
- Innovation and research focus on non-centralized solutions and enhancing off-chain transaction security and efficiency.
